title: Davis's Drug Guide for Nurses
description:
The medical information that nurses need - when, where, and how they need it!

Try before you buy with a 30-day FREE trial before being charged for a subscription.

Davis’s Drug Guide for Nurses, Nineteenth Edition, always puts safety first, emphasizing the medical information nurses need to know to administer medications competently and safely. Today’s most comprehensive nursing drug guide contains well-organized monographs for thousands of generic and trade name drugs reflecting the latest FDA approvals and changes.

The NINETEENTH EDITION - Life-saving guidance, at a glance :
• Over 5,000 monographs covering brand and generic names.
• Organized by generic names, with an index that includes generic and brand names, classifications, combination drugs, and herbals.
• Medication interaction between other medications, foods, and natural products.
• Drug cross reference.
• Herbal content.
• Pediatric, Geriatric, OB (Obstetrician), and Lactation cautions.
• IV administration sections.
• REMS (Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies).
• Pharmacogenomic content for better informed dosing.
• Canadian-specific medication content.
• Appendices and much more!

APP FEATURES :
• Attach personalized notes in the content that can be color coded and include images!
• Searching gets you the content you need in a flash.
• Bookmarks return you to your most used content with ease.

Authors:
April Hazard Vallerand, PhD, RN, FAAN
College of Nursing Alumni Endowed Professor
Wayne State University
College of Nursing
Detroit, Michigan

Cynthia A. Sanoski, BS, PharmD, BCPS, FCCP
Department Chair
Thomas Jefferson University
Jefferson School of Pharmacy
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Davis’s Drug Guide for Nurses, 18th edition is a publication of F.A. Davis Company and copyright © 2022, by F.A. Davis Company.
